    RemotePathDatasetÂ¶

    class pyremotedata.dataloader.RemotePathDataset(remote_path_iterator: RemotePathIterator, prefetch: int = 64, transform: Callable | None = None, target_transform: Callable | None = None, device: device | None = None, dtype: dtype | None = None, hierarchical: int = 0, hierarchy_parser: Callable | None = None, shuffle: bool = False, return_remote_path: bool = False, return_local_path: bool = False, verbose: bool = False)[source]

    Bases: IterableDataset

    Creates a PyTorch dataset from a RemotePathIterator.

    By default the dataset will return the image as a tensor and the remote path as a string.

    Hierarchical mode

    If hierarchical >= 1, the dataset is in âHierarchical modeâ and will return the image as a tensor and the label as a list of integers (class indices for each level in the hierarchy).

    The class_handles property can be used to get the class-idx mappings for the dataset.

    By default the dataset will use a parser which assumes that the hierarchical levels are encoded in the remote path as directories like so:

    â¦/level_n/â¦/level_1/level_0/image.jpg

    Where n = (hierarchical - 1) and level_0 is the leaf level.

    Parameters:

    • remote_path_iterator (RemotePathIterator) â The remote path iterator to create the dataset from.

    • prefetch (int) â The number of items to prefetch from the remote path iterator.

    • transform (callable, optional) â A function/transform that takes in an image as a torch.Tensor and returns a transformed version.

    • target_transform (callable, optional) â A function/transform that takes in the label (after potential parsing by parse_hierarchical) and transforms it.

    • device (torch.device, optional) â The device to move the tensors to.

    • dtype (torch.dtype, optional) â The data type to convert the tensors to.

    • hierarchical (int, optional) â The number of hierarchical levels to use for the labels. Default: 0, i.e. no hierarchy.

    • hierarchy_parser (callable, optional) â A function to parse the hierarchical levels from the remote path. Default: None, i.e. use the default parser.

    • return_remote_path (bool, optional) â Whether to return the remote path. Default: False.

    • return_local_path (bool, optional) â Whether to return the local path. Default: False.

    • verbose (bool, optional) â Whether to print verbose output. Default: False.

    Yields:

    tuple â

    A tuple containing the following elements:

    • torch.Tensor: The image as a tensor.

    • Union[str, List[int]]: The label as the remote path or as a list of class indices.

    • Optional[str]: The local path, if return_local_path is True.

    • Optional[str]: The remote path, if return_remote_path is True.
